job_title: Circulation Services Supervisor in Carlisle, PA
pros: Dickinson offers great PTO in addition to a lot of paid holidays.
cons: Pay increases don't happen often, and when they do they are minimal or at the same increase as health insurance. Additionally, there is no upward movement within departments. You'll have the same job title unless you take over a manager's position.

pros: Cute Small Town, intimate environment
cons: Lack of flexibility and creativity on views, older generation of leadership lacked the ability to connect and mentor the next generation of higher ed

job_title: Quantitative Reasoning Tutor in Carlisle, PA
pros: Learn lots of skills, communication, leadership, problem solving

pros: Lower teaching load compared to other small colleges (4-5 courses per year) Support for research and travel

pros: Great work life balance supported by department.

pros: - Pay is above minimum wage - Not the worst job in the world

pros: Vacation time is a big plus. It's nice to be able to spend the time during the holidays with family.
cons:
Pay is very low compared to other local companies. I could leave and get a warehouse job making much more than I'm currently making. 
You are treated very differently depending on your title. If you work as a support staff member, you do not receive the same treatment as the "higher ups". Staffing shortage makes it very difficult to complete your work and you are never compensated for taking on more to cover for the staff shortage. You are definitely over-worked and under-paid.

pros: Amazing benefits - Supportive staff environment - Flexible working hours - Great salary.
cons: The school is very progressive but the staff and faculty are not reflective of their diversity value. Need more Black and brown staff and faculty members.

pros: The Devil's Den convenience store was a fine place to work while I was studying. The boss was very personable.

pros: This internship is amazing and fun!

pros: mission driven, great students + colleagues, engaging work environment

review_title: Liberal Arts Education Really Prepares You
pros: Dickinson was the perfect environment to gain some of those more important professional skills like email communication, group presentations, and leadership.
cons: The smaller size us sometimes detrimental to experiencing life in a larger workplace.

pros: Liberal arts education with access to Success

review_title: Not as Poor as People Say

pros: Good location, wonderful organization to work for.

review_title: Dickinson under Durden a great place to work
job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in Carlisle, PA
pros: Excellent president who understood faculty and students needs and the politics of working with its board of trustees.  Students are engaged in community activities and most do their homework and contribute in class. Class sizes are small except for a few high demand classes for freshmen. Excellent global education program.
cons: Carlisle, PA is in the middle of nowhere. The town does not have an airport. the closest city is Harrisburg. Even though Harrisburg is PA's state capital, the place is quiet. The Harrisburg airport does not have many flights and the few it has are expensive. If you are single or a person of color you are unlikely to meet many people who look like you.

pros: Salary, excellent benefits, quiet small town location, some students, staff and faculty make job rewarding
cons: Lack of commitment and desire for change by upper management, lack of diversity among staff, sexist, lack of support, evident "entitled class" of faculty, students of color experience bias that is often not addressed, lack of career mobility, lack of social life, community has a racist tone

review_title: One of the best experiences of my undergraduate days.
job_title: Summer Student Worker in Boiling Springs, PA
pros:
The Dickinson College Farm Summer Student Worker position is a great opportunity to gain valuable hands on experience in sustainable food production, an introduction to renewable energy, along with developing team building skills, volunteer opportunities at neighboring farms, and food  workshops.
Perks include campus housing, discounted value added products,  and free vegetables.
cons: It's definitely challenging work, but it comes with literally tasting the fruits/ vegetables/ pizza of your labor.

pros: Dickinson College is a supportive employer that provides competitive compensation, excellent benefits, excellent vacation and flexible work hours.  It is the premier employer in its community.
cons: Since the college is small, opportunities for advancement can be limited.  Also, the college is located in a smallish town that is still not too far from Washington, New York and Baltimore.

job_title: Dining Services Student Worker in Carlisle, PA
pros: It is a very easy job in the dinning hall, but Snar and Querry can be a little demanding depending on the time of shifts.
cons: Sometimes, things is slow in the dinning hall so the job can be boring. You learn more skills in Snar and Querry. The pay is the PA minimum wage.

pros: Generous benefits package, many departments have flexible hours, a core group of employees who believe in the mission of the college, mission- and values-driven work, interesting work. Cultural activities available to the workforce (lectures, arts, etc.) HR programming a plus.
cons: Can be cliquey. Your experience really depends on who your manager is. Some instability in the higher-ed field currently. Can have limited opportunities for advancement in some sectors.

job_title: Retail Sales Associate in Carlisle, PA
pros: I enjoyed all the great food and all the social gatherings.
cons: The biggest con is the pay,beware of working casual, what it means is that you can work 1000 h in a school year with no paid time off when students are on break and no form of benefits.stay away from casual work! Be prepared to be on your feet all the time.  There's no room to grow there.

review_title: Friendly community, truly a college of the liberal arts
pros: Staff and faculty are genuinely committed to the mission of a liberal arts education; students are passionate, driven, intellectual, and eager to learn and immerse themselves into service. Most people are easy and friendly to work with though this does depend on your particular office.
cons: Can be a little insular like many campuses; tends to be mostly white students and staff/faculty but they're working on improving this.

review_title: I've always had a pleasant working experienc.
pros: They respect and treat you right as a person, and they'll teach you the skills you need to do the work. They'll alway help you if you have any questions.
cons: The pay could be higher. And the hours can be long, but it isn't too bad as long as you keep yourself busy with homework or something.

pros: There is always a great network of individuals who are willing to help you brainstorm, work through problems, or offer advice.
cons: It is, at its core, and institution. Thus, one is forced to deal with the politics that might just be a hassle for student employees. Especially if it affects you directly and you don't feel like you have a say.

pros: Dickinson has great supervisors, especially in the physics department who work with employees to help them teach.
cons: Pay is very low, and you usually cannot get many hours. Not a good job if you are looking for a lot of money.

pros: As a current Dickinson student, I work as a phonathon caller at the Office of Advancement. While the job can seem mundane at times, it is still a very fulfilling experience because I get to talk to so many interesting people. Potential connection building too! My boss is also probably the coolest boss ever.
cons: None that I can think of.

pros: As a student worker it's really nice how many options Dickinson offers its students as a co-curricular activity. The workplace in most offices are engaging and it's nice to see the results right away in the small college community.
cons: Wages for student workers are very low (average 7-8$/hour)

review_title: Fantastic for entry-level, but little career advancement without Ph.D
pros:
- Great campus, very pro-environment and sustainability
- Friendly faculty, staff, and student
- Great for recent graduates 
- Charming town close to NYC, DC, Philly, Pittsburg
cons:
- Raises are cost of living adjustment
- Very little room for advancement

job_title: Campus Recreation Coordinator in Carlisle, PA
pros:
-Lots of creative room 
-Flexible hours
-Supervisors are extremely involved and open to suggestions on programing
cons:
-Low pay
-Lack of real world experience
-High supervisor turnover
-Lack of singular mission of vision for programming

pros: Its a great job. The co-workers are friendly and help you out. The work environment is professional but also not too serious. The management actively responds to feedback
cons: Not much to share. Its a great place to work.

review_title: Very flexible and work is what you would think
job_title: Dining Services Worker in Carlisle, PA
pros: The scheduling is very flexible with a student's schedule.
cons: The work can be tiring and management does not always keep tabs on other workers and lets them slack off.

pros: It's a great school with great students, faculty, and administrattors
cons: The location is in the middle of nowhere, but it's a cute and charming little town.

pros: The job is exciting and fillded with new challanges of computer repair. The job is pretty laid back, and the boss is very understanding.
cons: You are a skilled technician and you make 8.05 an hour.

pros: tuition benefits are a nice perk, ample amount of PTO and people are nice
cons: they are restructuring many offices on campus and letting qualified, hard working staff go

review_title: OK, if you are administrator not staff.
pros: Dickinson is a great place to work if you are an administrator, not staff.
cons: Staff are treated differently than administrators and faculty, though this is not surprising. Very common practice at colleges.

review_title: Ample opportunities for students to get jobs
pros: variety, dedication to student needs, ability to change jobs, many students work
cons: low pay rate, some jobs are better than others, hard to balance the full work study requirements with schoolwork

pros: Great training and constant encouragement to communicate among staff and between staff and higher management
cons: Some shifts can be late and the tutors may have to work with topics that they are unfamiliar with.

pros: It was a good experience with good leadership.
cons: There were no cons that I can think of.

pros: Strong sense of community and dedication to students.  Great colleagues in a friendly and supportive work environment.

pros: Very flexible, open to new ideas and different ways to accomplish goal.
